0: The Syrian government has turned hospitals into "instruments of repression" in its drive to crush opposition, Amnesty International has said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Wounded patients in at least four government-run hospitals have been subjected to torture and other ill-treatment, including by medical staff, the human rights group said in a report. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Other hospital workers suspected of treating protesters and others injured during demonstrations have themselves faced arrest and torture, it added. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "It is deeply alarming that the Syrian authorities seem to have given the security forces a free rein in hospitals, and that in many cases hospital staff appear to have taken part in torture and ill treatment of the very people they are supposed to care for," said Cilina Nasser, an Amnesty researcher. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Syria has intensified a crackdown on protests and an armed insurgency despite western condemnation. The UN says the crackdown has killed 3,000 people. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Syrian authorities say they are fighting armed terrorist groups in the central city of Homs who have killed civilians, security forces and prominent figures. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Amnesty said patients had been assaulted by medical staff, health workers and security personnel in the national hospitals in Homs, the coastal city of Banias and the border town of Tel Kelakh, and at the military hospital in Homs. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR One doctor at Homs military hospital told Amnesty that he had seen four doctors and more than 20 nurses abusing patients. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A man was delivered unconscious to the national hospital in Tel Kelakh on 22 August after being beaten by security forces, the report said. "There were around seven or eight security men, some carrying rifles, and nurses wearing white robes crowded around him. He opened his eyes and said: 'Where am I?' They all suddenly jumped on him and started beating him and hitting him," according to a witness in the emergency room. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Patients have also been removed from hospitals. On 7 September, security forces looking for an alleged armed field commander opposed to the government raided al-Birr wa al-Khadamat hospital in Homs, the report said. When they did not find him, they arrested 18 wounded people, it said.
